bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Florence M. Read to Henry Rose Carter, September 15, 1923

div1.p: Read thanks Carter for sending the International Health Board a letter from Dr. Osterhout, regarding the possibility of Osterhout doing yellow fever work.

div1.head: Letter from Florence M. Read to Henry Rose Carter, September 15, 1923
div1.opener:
ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF
FREDERICK F. RUSSELL, M.D.
GENERAL DIRECTOR
JOHN A. FERRELL, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE UNITED STATES
VICTOR G. HEISER, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE EAST
H. H. HOWARD, M.D.
DIRECTOR FOR
THE WEST INDIES
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH BOARD
OF
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
61 BROADWAY, NEW YORK
CABLE ADDRESS “INTERCOM”
MEMBERS
GEORGE E. VINCENT
CHAIRMAN
WALLACE BUTTRICK
DAVID L. EDSALL
SIMON FLEXNER
RAYMOND B. FOSDICK
EDWIN O. JORDAN
VERNON KELLOGG
T. MITCHELL PRUDDEN
JOHN D. ROCKEFELLER, JR.
WICKLIFFE ROSE
VICTOR C. VAUGHAN
WILLIAM H. WELCH
EDWIN R. EMBREE
SECRETARY
FLORENCE M. READ
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
September 15, 1923
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
Thank you for your letter of September
10 enclosing the letter from Doctor Osterhout. We
have sent him a personal history record blank, and
are going to speak to Doctor White about him as a
possibility for yellow fever work.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Florence M. Read Doctor H. R. Carter
Badin Hospital
Badin, North Carolina
FMR:EP
